alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 9:27PM AKST until November 21 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 730 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 PM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - The crest should occur between midnight and 4 am Tuesday. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 9:00pm the stage was 21.98 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet. Impacts: At 24.0 feet: Water levels will be at the bridge abutment of 9 mile bridge along Mitkof Highway.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
